Newsletter RSS Mobile Facebook Twitter Beaches | Best of OC | Blogs | Columns | Comics | Contests | Food | Gift of Giving | Health and Fitness | Home and Garden | Horoscopes | OC Moms | OC People | Outdoors | Pets | Photos | Puzzles and Games | Shopping and Deals | Video «Previous Post Next Post» All Posts Top 25 best drive-thrus for 2008
October 9th, 2008, 6:45 am· ·posted by Nancy Luna, Staff Writer
Each October, QSR Magazine ranks America’s Top 25 best fast-food drive throughs based on an in-depth look at speed of service, order accuracy, speaker clarity and appearance of menu boards. (see rankings below)
This year, Chick-fil-A nabbed the top award, ranking as the overall winner for its combined score. Locally, Orange County-based Taco Bell , Del Taco and El Pollo Loco ranked among the best 15 with Del Taco ranking the highest at No. 5.
Some other noteworthy comments from the study:
- El Pollo Loco saw a huge drop in order accuracy, going from No. 4 in 2007 to No. 10. Spokeswoman Julie Weeks suggested this as the reason for the drop.“We introduced a record number of new, limited time offerings in the past year, which may have contributed to this year’s order accuracy ranking.”
–Also, in the“accuracy”category, Del Taco moved up from No. 7 last year to No. 3 in 2008, while Taco Bell didn’t budge—remaining at No. 13.
- Looks like Taco Bell, which ranked No. 7 overall, could have made the Top 5 had it done better in these two areas: order accuracy and speaker clarity.
- Remind me never to hit Popeyes . It performed badly in nearly every category, thus its No. 25 overall ranking. Chick-fil-A, on the other hand, did the best in nearly every category but speed of service.
- Wendy’s is the speediest of the major fast-food chains tested. It nabbed the No. 1 spot in that category. I don’t want to take away from this ranking, but…..Wendy’s order accuracy came in at No. 12, which makes me think they’re whipping up food in a speedy manner, but not necessarily getting orders correct all the time.
More details: QSR’s America’s 2008 Best Drive-Thru Study
Below is a chart listing the Top 25 chains, followed by their rankings in Speed of Service, Accuracy and Speaker Clarity. For rankings on Menu Board appearance, go here .
Tell us: After reading the scores below, let me know if you think it reflects the kind of service you are getting at the drive-through. For example, I’m surprised by the No. 13 ranking of Del Taco on speed of service. I thought they’d do better than that.
Fast-food Chain Top 25 Fastest Service** Order Accuracy Speaker Clarity Chick-fil-A 1 8 (175.01) 1 1 McDonald’s 2 5 (158.77) 6 5 Burger King 3 3 (153.06) 8 11 Wendy’s 4 1 (131.08) 12 4 Del Taco *(Lake Forest) 5 13 (188.7) 3 3 Krystal 6 17 (193.77) 5 2 Taco Bell *(Irvine) 7 4 (154.88) 13 12 Carl’s Jr 8 14 (189.65) 7 6 Jack in the Box 9 12 (188.11) 4 21 Checkers 10 6 (162.35) 15 15 Bojangles’ 11 2 (151.35) 23 10 Arby’s 12 7 (162.86) 14 18 KFC 13 10 (178.52) 9 17 El Pollo Loco *(Costa Mesa) 14 16 (192.66) 10 9 Culvers 15 25 (267.92) 2 13 Long John Silver’s 16 11 (180.06) 19 14 Hardee’s 17 20 (205.77) 11 19 Rally’s 18 15 (190.07) 18 22 White Castle 19 23 (214.29) 16 20 Church’s 20 9 (176.66) 25 24 A&W 21 22 (213.5) 20 7 Whataburger 22 19 (205.47) 22 23 Captain D’s 23 24 (243.74) 17 8 Dairy Queen 24 21 (209.37) 21 16 Popeyes 25 18 (204.66) 24 25 *indicates Orange County headquarters **Average time listed in seconds, per vehicle Posted in: Burger Joints • Fast food news • Marketing Buzz • McDonald's • Arby's

Register Food Writers
Paul Hodgins is The Register’s wine columnist. He pens the Booze on a Budget column focusing on beer, wine and Happy Hour news every Tuesday and Friday on the Fast Food Maven blog. Marla Fisher is our Deals Diva blogger . She writes often about restaurant and grocery deals. The Food Frenzy blog gives readers daily reviews on local hidden gems in Orange County.
